text.title: Seychellois Creole phrasebook
text.p:
Seychellois Creole
(
kreol
or
seselwa
) is a language of the
Seychelles
.

p.s: Some in this still need to be translated .
If you know anything about this language , you can by and .
Y = y sounds like i in ink ;
Some in this still need to be translated .
If you know anything about this language , you can by and .

list.item:
Fine , thank you . :
" Byen mersi , oumenm ?
"

What is your name ? :
" Ki mannyer ou apele ?
"

item.s: My name is [ name ] . : " Mon apel [ name ] "

list.item: Nice to meet you . [ Pleasure ] : " Plezir "

Please . :
" Silvouple " Silvouple is pronounced Seelvooplay

Excuse me . :
" Eskiz mon " Mon is pronounced bluntly , not as mohnn
I 'm sorry . : " Pardon " Pardon is pronounced bluntly , not as pardohnn

I ca n't speak [ name of language ] [ well ] . :
" Mon pa kapab koz [ name of language][byen ] "

Do you speak English ? :
" Eski ou koz Angle ?
" Angle ( English ) is pronounced as Anglay

Is there someone here who speaks English ? :
" Eski i annan en dimounn la ki koz Angle ?
"

Have a good evening . : " Pas en bon sware .
" Sware is pronounced swaray

I do n't understand . :
" Mon pa konpran "

Where is the toilet ? : ?
" Oli toilet ?
"

What are you doing ? : " Ki ou pe fer ?
"

When ? :
" Kan " Kan is pronounced bluntly , not as Kahnn
I got hurt : " Monn ganny blese " Blese is pronounced blaysay

I do n't want that . :
" Mon pa le sa . " Le is pronounced Lay

text.p:
midday
- midi pronounced mee jee ;

one o'clock
- en er(pronounced as anne air ) ;

two o'clock
- dez er ( pronounced as days air ) ;

three o'clock
- trwaz er(as in Trois heure ) ;

four o'clock
- kat er(pronounced as cat were ) ;

five o'clock
- senk er(pronounced as sank air ) ;

six o'clock
- siz er(pronounced as seas air ) ;

seven o'clock
- set er ( pronounced sayt air ) ;

eight o'clock
- wit er ( pronounced as weet air ) ;

nine o'clock
- nef er ( pronounced knave air ) ;

ten o'clock
- dis er ( pronounced jeez air ) ;

eleven o'clock
- onz er(pronounced onzair ) ;

midnight
- minwi ( pronounced mean wee ) ;

p.s: bomaten - morning pronounced beau-mah-ten ( blunt n ) ;
gran maten - early morning pronounced gran-mah-ten(blunt n )

text.p:

p.s: rouz - red prounounced as woo ooze ;
blan - white as in blunt , the n is silent ;
nwar - black pronounces as nou argh ;
somon - pink prononced as so mon with a silent n ;

text.p:
' Where is the bus stop ?
' '
Oli bus stop ? '

hi.s: Ki bis ki al ... ? ' ( ' bus ' pronounced almost like ' bis ' )

p.s:
'
I want to go to ...
Mon le al ... ' ( pronounced mo-lay-al )

hi.s: Konbyen pou al ... ' ( pronounced com-ye pu-allay )
Kote ki annan en bon restoran ? ' ( pronounced cotay-ki ana eh bon restauruh )
Ki restoran ou rekomande ? ' ( restaurant pronounced as ' restauruh ' and recomande as rekomanday )

text.p:
'
Where is the ... bar ?
' ' Oli bar ... ? ' ( you 'd insert the name of the bar )

'
Is there a local bar ?
' ' I anan en bar lokal ? ' ( pronounced ee-ana eh bar lokal )

' Where is it ?
' ' Kote i ete ? ' ( pronounced cotay-yetay )

p.s: Mon pe al laboutik - I am going to the shop
Cars drive on the left side of the road .
Bus seem to have the right of away most of the time .
Try not to get in its way .
